sanskrit_verse:
संमार्जनौपाञ्जनेन सेकेनौल्लेखनेन च ।
गवां च परिवासेन भूमिः शुद्ध्यति पञ्चभिः ॥ ५.१२४॥
transliteration:
saṃmārjanopāñjanena sekenaullekhanena ca |
gavāṃ ca parivāsena bhūmiḥ śudhyati pañcabhiḥ || 5.124||
sph_interpretive_translation: The earth is purified through five means: sweeping, application of cow-dung, watering, scraping, and the presence of cows.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from natural order and ritual purity
Causation aligns with sequential acts of purification
Capacity-based responsibility lies in maintaining environmental sanctity
Restoration logic requires re-establishment of purity through prescribed actions
Consciousness alignment occurs when space reflects divine order
executable_legal_axioms: IF land purity status = impure THEN execute purification sequence: [sweeping → cow-dung application → watering → scraping → cow presence]
IF purification action ≠ completed THEN capacity_allocation = restricted until completion
IF space consciousness ≠ aligned THEN initiate cow-presence protocol for 24-hour duration
IF land use ≠ agricultural or spiritual THEN purification threshold = elevated
IF purification cycle ≠ initiated within 3 days of contamination THEN jurisdictional notice issued
supreme_court_application: In land disputes involving ritual or ecological degradation, the Supreme Court shall mandate purification protocols prior to adjudication. Responsibility for contamination rests with the entity whose action caused disruption to natural order. Restoration precedes litigation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that impurity manifests through neglect of dharmic maintenance. Anupūrvaśaḥ demonstrates purification as sequential cause-effect. Proportional responsibility aligns with degree of contamination. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that correction restores dharma without inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate purification completion process under witness of local dharma authority
Assign responsibility assumption protocol to contaminating party within 24 hours
Implement capacity restoration via supervised purification sequence
Execute integrity reintegration through public acknowledgment of corrected state
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored through purification. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
